oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Meta-Selective Arene C-H Bond Olefination of Arylacetic Acid Using a Nitrile-Based Directing Group
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BERA, M
MODAK, A
PATRA, T
MAJI, A
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CATALYZED DIRECT ARYLATION
CARBON-HYDROGEN BONDS
FUNCTIONALIZATION LOGIC
NATURAL-PRODUCTS
ACTIVATION
PALLADIUM
BORYLATION
TEMPLATE
CONSTRUCTION
REACTIVITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A nitrile-based template attached with a phenylacetic acid framework promoted meta-selective CH bond olefination. This palladium-catalyzed protocol is applicable to a wide range of substituted phenylacetic acids and tolerates a variety of functional groups. The versatility of this operationally simple method has been demonstrated through drug diversification.
